ai.summary: A demanding 22.2 km hike in the UK designed for experienced walkers. Expect mixed terrain, long ascents, and exposed sections; solid fitness and navigation are essential.
ai.terrain_summary: The route mixes rural lanes, grassy fields, and uneven tracks with occasional forested or rocky sections. Mud is common after rain; expect several steep ascents and descents, stiles or gates, and exposed stretches that can be windy.
ai.safety_notes: Check forecast and daylight; start early to avoid darkness. Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate clothing; be prepared for mud, wind, or rain. Carry a map, compass and/or GPS; know your route. Bring enough water and snacks; plan for 4–6 hours or more. Tell someone your route and expected return time; carry a charged phone as backup. Be cautious on exposed sections and near edge drops; watch for livestock and gates. Respect land access rules and any closures; carry a torch for navigation in low light if needed.
recommended_gear: Map and compass and/or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Phone with portable charger or power bank
Extra warm layers (gloves, hat) depending on season
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and longer days; winter hikes are more challenging with shorter daylight and more mud or ice.

seo.title: Hutton Millenium Walk – 22.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the 22.2 km Hutton Millenium Walk in the UK. A hard route with varied terrain, long ascents, and exposed sections. Prepare with proper gear and safety tips.
